[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Integration] [Block Size Limits] If shuffle() is called with more transactions than can fit in a block, does it properly handle truncation without corrupting state? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Integration] [Iterator Exhaustion] If the returned iterator from signed_transaction_iterator() is not fully consumed, can it leak resources or leave DelayedQueue in inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Feature: fuzzing] [Fuzzing Surface] Can the fuzzing feature expose shuffle_generic() in production builds accidentally, allowing attackers to manipulate transaction ordering? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Function: shuffle_generic()] [Generic Type Safety] Can shuffle_generic() be misused with incorrect transaction types that don't implement UseCaseAwareTransaction properly, causing runtime errors? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Struct: Config] [Governance Attack] Can a malicious governance proposal set spread factors to values that create extreme delays (e.g., 2^64-1), effectively censoring all transactions? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Struct: Config] [MEV Opportunity] Can asymmetric spread factors be exploited by MEV bots to predict transaction ordering and front-run users? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Struct: Config] [Default Values] Does Config::default() provide safe default values, or can default configuration lead to unfair ordering or DoS conditions? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/iterator.rs] [Performance] [Computational Complexity] What is the computational complexity of select_next_txn_inner(), and can an attacker craft transactions that cause O(nÂ²) or worse behavior? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Performance] [BTreeMap Operations] Can the repeated BTreeMap insertions and deletions in pop_head() cause performance degradation with large transaction sets, leading to validator timeouts? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Performance] [Memory Allocation] Can the clone() operation on Config in ShuffledTransactionIterator::new() cause performance issues or memory spikes with large configurations? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Edge Case] [Zero Spread Factor] Can spread_factor values of 0 cause transactions to be delayed until output_idx + 1 with no spreading, breaking the fairness guarantee? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Edge Case] [Maximum Output Index] What happens when output_idx approaches usize::MAX? Can overflow cause all transactions to become perpetually delayed? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Edge Case] [Single Transaction] Can processing a single transaction from a sender cause incorrect state where the account is marked as having try_delay_till but no subsequent transactions arrive? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/iterator.rs] [Edge Case] [Empty Iterator] Can next() be called on an empty iterator repeatedly without causing panic or undefined behavior? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Edge Case] [Account Without UseCase] Can an account exist without an associated use case in the data structures, causing expect_use_case_key() to panic? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Invariant] [Accounts and UseCases Sync] Can the accounts HashMap and use_cases HashMap become desynchronized, where an account references a use case that doesn't exist? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Invariant] [Placeholder Consistency] Can an account or use case exist in both the main queue and placeholder queue simultaneously, causing state corruption? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Invariant] [Delay Key Uniqueness] Can two different transactions have the same DelayKey (same try_delay_till and input_idx), causing BTreeMap corruption? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Invariant] [Empty Queue Tracking] Can use_cases_by_delay reference an empty UseCase, or account_by_delay reference an empty Account, violating the stated invariants? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Invariant] [Transaction Reachability] Can a transaction become unreachable (not in any queue) due to logic errors during use case migration or account removal? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Trait Bound] [Thread Safety] UseCaseAwareShuffler implements Send + Sync, but does DelayedQueue safely handle concurrent access through Arc if Config is shared? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/iterator.rs] [Ownership] [Iterator Lifetime] Can the 'static lifetime on returned Box<dyn Iterator> cause use-after-free if the iterator outlives the Config? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/delayed_queue.rs] [Mutability] [Interior Mutability] Does DelayedQueue use any interior mutability (RefCell, Mutex, etc.) that could cause runtime panics or deadlocks? (High)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/iterator.rs] [Generic Type] [Type Constraints] Are the bounds on UseCaseAwareTransaction + Debug sufficient, or can types that don't properly implement parse_sender()/parse_use_case() cause runtime errors? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/transaction_shuffler/use_case_aware/mod.rs] [Type Conversion] [SignedTransaction vs SignatureVerifiedTransaction] Can inconsistencies in how these two transaction types implement UseCaseAwareTransaction cause different shuffling results for the same logical transaction? (High)
